name: Merton Hotel

reviews.text: we stayed here on b/b ,would like to see more vegetarian option for breakfast. was a pleasant hotel .stuff very friendly , the pillow should be more fluffy and it is a time to renew them. We ate twice in the restaurant and the price was very reasonable..shame about the weather ,but we had a pleasant stay would recommend it to others. Close to shops and restaurant by foot, free car parking a bonus.
reviews.title: more like 4 srar hotel.

reviews.text: Not the real Gary Barlow, Just a very good impersonator (Dan Hadfield) who could pass for the real Gary anytime. He was the star act the weekend we were there such was the calibre of the entertainment. We'd missed Whitney the week before and Abba were due to play this week. They had wrestling, rock n roll bands, quizzes, kids entertainers. All good fun.
reviews.title: Gary Barlow sat next to us at breakfast time.

reviews.text: WARNING - DO NOT COME TO THIS HOTEL IF YOU ARE ON WEIGHTWATCHERS OR SLIMMING WORLD - The food is too good to miss out on. I've never seen so much choice. There was a carvery every night (the meat every night was cooked perfectly and carved really thick) plus at least another four main meal courses to choose from, a lovely salad bar plus at least a dozen different gateauxs to help yourself to. There was even a special section for the kids to choose fish whales, spaghetti hoops etc. Breakfast was the usual fayre, again all piping hot. They even provided goats Milk, which I've never seen in a hotel before, which my husband drinks due to an allergy
reviews.title: Sleepless nights

reviews.text: If you don't want to use the main restaurant, if you are on half board they give you an allowance for the on-site Italian restaurant. Plus there is also Jersey Joe's, an American style diner, but this was only open on our last day - think it only opens during peak times ie main holidays.
reviews.title: great staff and excellent food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Getting into town wasn't a problem as its literally ten minutes away through the park at the bottom of the road.
reviews.title: Family Holiday Hotel

reviews.text: Very well run family orientated hotel. Swimming complex brilliant for children of all ages 0-100years. Easy walking distance from St Helier town centre. Only five minutes from ferry. Restaurants to cater for every need. All of the staff very attentive, our only problem was the herd of elephants in the room above making sleep sometimes difficult. The hotel management did their very best to correct this.
reviews.title: Family half term break

reviews.text: We booked the Merton for a half-term break on a b&b basis with our two children, aged 10 and 7. We chose the hotel based almost entirely on its Aquadome, which is located across the (small and quiet) road from the hotel. We weren't disappointed - the kids swam in the indoor and outdoor complex every day, and also learned to body board and surf in the Flowrider, which was very good value for money. The whole complex is very well put together and offers plenty of relaxation for adults as well as fun for kids.
reviews.title: Good family hotel, great swim facilities, easy walking distance to St Helier

reviews.text: The hotel itself attracts a broad clientele - while we were there, we saw plenty of families but also retired couples and groups of friends, as well as organised tours from other countries. We had a family suite, which was two rooms (one with double bed, one with bunk beds) and a bathroom. This was clean and neat, and serviced well daily.
reviews.title: BEST EVER

reviews.text: The food and facilities in the hotel were good. A kids club runs from 6.30pm to 8.30pm nightly, with further kids' activities until 9.30pm for older children (eg: dance time). There is a creche for smaller kids. There is a kids' tea from 5.30pm in the main buffet restaurant (The Belvedere), but this is quite expensive for the food on offer - £10.50 per child. Jersey Joes, on the main level, serves hot dogs, burgers and similar American-style food for far less money. The other restaurant is Berlotti's which is a nice Italian. Breakfast is served in the Belvedere buffet-style, with a good selection of hot and cold food. We didn't eat there in the evening as again, it seemed expensive (£20+ per adult), and we're not big fans of buffets.
reviews.title: Great half term break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a small play garden at the back for younger kids, and a games room with pool tables, air hockey etc. Nightly entertainment is well planned - plenty of tribute bands and also some wrestling and sumo, so all tastes catered for.
reviews.title: Merton Hotel Jersey Channel Islands

reviews.text: Very impressed with the merton excellent breakfast and dinner both in main restaurant and the Italian within the hotel, the kids also loved jersey Joe's Diner. There was also a fantastic Kids club for two hours from 630-830 my two loved it they were 5 and 8, this enabled us to have a nice dinner in peace after a busy day. Great location near a beautiful park and 10 minutes to walk into St Helier. Would recommend having a car as we opted to use the buses and gets busy in holiday time and a walk to the station.
reviews.title: Excellent family hotel

reviews.text: Excellent swimming pool all clean and water a good temperature, rooms lovely and beds comfy, all staff we encountered were friendly and efficient. Lastly the entertainment in evening was brilliant for all family would definitely go again.
reviews.title: Excellent value for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a well located spacious hotel with a range of family friendly facilities.
reviews.title: Superb hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On B & B basis we had great breakfasts and using the Continental room service was beneficial when I had an early start.
reviews.title: Great friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main restaurant had a wide variety of well cooked, delicious fresh foods in the evening to suit all tastes and ages; all generally healthy too. We used a discount voucher which they gave us at reception, so this made it exceptional value compared to restaurant prices in town.
reviews.title: Needs a lift

reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights for classic car weekend. Very good position, safe car park. Breakfast good choices, ate in Bonetti's each evening where food and service were very good. Particularly liked the scallop starter.
reviews.title: Something for everyone

reviews.text: Room perfectly adequate with small bathroom. Shower however was excellent, better than 5* hotel we stayed in night before trip.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location.

reviews.text: Family friendly hotel with good pool, activities for children and entertainment for all.
reviews.title: 2nd Visit still as good as we hoped

reviews.text: Definitely worth using as a base for touring jersey.
reviews.title: Merton Suites superb

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel over the Spring Bank Holiday and loved every moment of my stay. I may not have made full use of the hotel's facilities but what I did see and use were great.
reviews.title: A brilliant hotel for families of all ages

description: At The Merton Hotel, for over 90 years, guests have been delighted and entertained by our high level of hospitality and unbeatable range of facilities. Whether you are travelling as a couple, family or group, you'll find everything to suit your needs conveniently situated under one roof.
